page.title: 12HEDGEROWS,TREES-CANON PYON
page.content: Very little farmhouse cider (scrumpy) or perry now produced due to grubbing up of orchards.There are still{damson trees in roadside hedgerows,originally planted to provide fruit for the {dyeing industry.}In recent times many hedgerows have been removed.Hedges are cut by various types of machinery.The thorny debris causes puncture problems for motorists and cyclists,and is a common topic in newspapers and pubs. Hedgerows on Westhope still have{holly trees first planted to provide sheep fodder and shelter during deep snow. {Oak,}the dominant type of tree, is still important in the landscape.{Ash and{field maple}are slowly filling the gaps created by Dutch Elm disease.Some local farmers &{'Friends of Westhope'- a local conservation group,are engaged upon an active tree planting scheme.
